alert.note: Alert for Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 6:07AM CST until February 22 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Obion. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clayton, Woodland Mills, Fremont, Crystal, Old Fremont, Walnut Log, Spout Springs and Roneys Store. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
